meanings.sent1: The group of rascals giggled as they planned their prank.
meanings.sent2: The teacher caught the rascals trying to sneak out of class.
meanings.sent3: The rascals hid the principal's keys as a joke.
meanings.sent4: The rascals in the story stole from the rich to give to the poor.
meanings.sent5: Beware of the rascals who try to trick you with their lies.

meanings.sent1: The children at the park were little rascals, running around and laughing.
meanings.sent2: Grandpa always had a twinkle in his eye, like a playful rascal.
meanings.sent3: The rascal of a puppy chewed up my favorite shoes.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter echoed through the room, like that of a mischievous rascal.
meanings.sent5: The kitten's playful antics made her the little rascal of the house.

meanings.sent1: The pirate captain was known as the most feared rascal on the high seas.
meanings.sent2: The charming rogue turned out to be a cunning rascal in disguise.
meanings.sent3: The rascal of a con artist tricked many with his smooth talk.
meanings.sent4: The masked rascal stole the priceless jewel from the museum.
meanings.sent5: The mysterious stranger had the air of a dangerous rascal about him.
